channel.title: How do i turn on spawning on in testscape u get 2 be a mod if u help!
channel.description: i realy need help on this please help me[br][size=1]Posted at: July 12, 2006, 12:42:15 PM[/size][hr]come on does anybody know how theres a few more things i need help with 2 u can me a mod if u tell me if u know how i can make u a mod!?!?!

item.title: How do i turn on spawning on in testscape u get 2 be a mod if u help!
item.dc:creator: @jarnohhh jarnohhh
item.description:
@jarnohhh wrote:

Go to the character files, click on your file, than search for “rights” than change the 0 to the right u want:

0 = normal player
1 = player mod
2 = Administrator
3 = Owner
4 = Hided Owner.

-----Spawning----
If it says something like, wrong id or something than u got a silab pickup, so for a 3 number code u do like 00995 100 or for a blue phat 01042 or for a silab item 10483 or something

Gl with it.

Read full topic
item.source: How do i turn on spawning on in testscape u get 2 be a mod if u help!

Well, In Testscape the spawning is for mods only as a default, so to start, you could make yourself a moderator.

item.title: How do i turn on spawning on in testscape u get 2 be a mod if u help!
item.dc:creator: @cawagula cawagula
item.description:
@cawagula wrote:

Item spawning is simply:

::item #### - that one spawns 1 item on ground

::pickup #### (##) - That spawns as many items as you want in your inventory if their noted.

Replace #### with code

Replace (##) with how many you want, but don’t add the ( )'s they were just to show you their different from the other ####'s.

Read full topic

@taj3430 wrote:

Change the whole admin part in the client java, download another source and copy their one. then put it where the other one was. it is what i did. and yeah. if you change one of those and change it to your player name… you ahve those rights!

item.title: How do i turn on spawning on in testscape u get 2 be a mod if u help!
item.dc:creator: @cawagula cawagula
item.description:
@cawagula wrote:

I think testscape has it built in already…

::npc ####

Replace #### with NPC id, Let me test it to make sure.

EDIT

Just made sure, it works. Now where’s my mod position?
